properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 24 at 5:24AM MST by NWS Great Falls MT
properties.description:
Fog has developed in some valleys of Southwest Montana this
morning. Areas including the Bozeman and Big Hole valleys indicate
some reduction in visibility in fog. Visibility may fall to below
one mile in some areas, and some roads may become slick and/or
icy.

However, low clouds and fog have moved into the Monida Pass,
Centennial valley, Raynolds Pass, and West Yellowstone areas.
While visibility may be reduced to less than one mile at times,
these areas may also receive brief periods of freezing drizzle
this morning. This may cause more widespread slick and/or icy
roadways.

If you plan on driving around Southwest Montana this morning,
allow yourself extra time to reach your destination. Also, make
sure to take it slow, so you can react to changing visibility
and/or road conditions.

NWSheadline: Areas of fog across portions of Southwest Montana this morning
